poem:
Title: Unfolding Sorrows

Sweet Kiev, ripe Kharkiv,
plucked by icy winter's missiles.
The snow, now red, shivers—
crying a tale of two cities.

Countless cries echo 
from steel birds raining iron.
Yet, in the sorrowful song,
a sturdy spirit whispers "persevere".

Is it the winter wind,
or the wounded mother's lullaby?
So much pain beneath the frost,
yet always, the sun promises to rise.
